timeline.message: update repeating grp done action with new logic
fix code when updating the repeating grp count

timeline.bodyText:
Not sure why this is +=. In the case that the value in the reference edit text changes, shouldn't the new value be the new number of repeating groups generated?
The logic atm looks at the difference and either generates extra groups for a +ve diff or deletes excess groups for a -ve diff.
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: Ideally the new value should be the summation of all the groups generated otherwise the count object will have incorrect value.
replies.author: bennsimon

timeline.bodyText: Do we need the else block? Is there ever an instance when stepJsonObject is null?
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: yeah for malformed json form
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: The method throws JSONException, so I'm thinking malformed JSON will be covered here? The calling method can then figure out how to handle the exception, no?
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: That is a NPE check.
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: Ok, but when is the stepJsonObject null?
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: either way, you can simply return null without the else block, right?
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText:
Ok, but when is the stepJsonObject null?
When the step does not exist ... for malformed json forms
either way, you can simply return null without the else block, right?
I will still need an if block
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: yea, we can remove the else block though.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

timeline.bodyText: Based on https://github.com/OpenSRP/opensrp-client-native-form/pull/504/files#r512021105. Should countFieldObject ever be null?
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: yeah for malformed json form
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: #504 (comment)
replies.author: vincent-karuri

timeline.bodyText: Any reason to remove this? This was recommended as a better user experience by Roger onaio/rdt-standard#319 (comment).
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: Yeah, this feature breaks the normal behaviour of repeating group, it adds a bug ... it creates twice the number of groups needed.
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: Ok, were you able to figure out why that happens?
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: referenceEditText gains focus when cursor is on it, a number is entered ...  then after referenceEditText loses focus when the done button is clicked it fires the addOnDoneAction from focusChange listener at the same time the done button clickListener does the same ... so it generates twice the number of groups.
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: Cool. Would removing the addOnDoneAction from the done button work then?
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: yeah ... thats why i proposed that to use the feature one has to hide the done button.
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: I meant that since onFocusChanged is triggered when the button is clicked (after entering text) we can simply use onFocusChanged and remove the onclicklistener from the done button.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: I dont think thats a good idea, looks like a hack ... i think one has to be disabled.
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText: It really isn't. The point of the feature (from Roger's comment) is to generate the repeating group when one navigates away from the reference edit text. Clicking on other views (including the done button) counts as navigating away.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: Why would you need the unclickable done button if you have a onFocusChangeListener on a referenceEditText? I dont get it but anyways ... This needs to be configurable since not all implementation expect that behaviour.
replies.author: bennsimon

replies.bodyText:
tbh, it's only for backward compatibility, we don't need a button any more. The button being "truly" clickable or not doesn't really change the end-user experience so that's not a problem.
You can make it configurable, but any time someone wants both the button and focus change to be supported, the bug will show up again.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

timeline.bodyText: I see the logic to write into the count object was moved but is the validation still being done? i.e. is JsonFormFragmentPresenter .validate(widgetArgs.getFormFragment(), referenceEditText, false); still called?
timeline.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: It's useful where the reference edit text has validators added.
replies.author: vincent-karuri

replies.bodyText: good catch
replies.author: bennsimon
